12. The computing system of claim 11, wherein the item variant information is obtained from a first catalog associated with the first seller.

13. The computing system of claim 6, wherein determination that the item corresponds to the first item from the plurality of items includes:comparing the first feature vector with a plurality of feature vectors associated with the plurality of items to generate a probability score for each of the plurality of items indicative of a similarity between the item represented in the user-provided image and each of the plurality of items.

14. The computing system of claim 6, wherein the program instructions, when executed by the one or more processors, further cause the one or more processors to at least:determine, based at least in part on at least one of the first feature vector or the image information, an item category associated with the item represented in the user-provided image; anddetermine the plurality of items based at least in part on the item category.

15. A computer-implemented method, comprising:determining image information associated with an item represented in a user-provided image;comparing the image information to a plurality of item information associated with a plurality of items included in a plurality of catalogs associated with a first plurality of sellers, wherein each of the plurality of item information includes a uniform resource locator (URL);determining, based at least in part on the comparison of the image information to the plurality of item information, that the item corresponds to a first item from the plurality of items;determining, from the first plurality of sellers and based at least in part on the first item and the plurality of catalogs, a second plurality of sellers that sell the first item;associating the user-provided image with the second plurality of sellers in a mapping database;obtaining, from a user, a selection of the user-provided image; andpresenting, in association with a representation of the item or the first item, a purchase control enabling purchase of the first item from a first seller from the second plurality of sellers.

16. The computer-implemented method of claim 15, further comprising:determining second image information associated with a second item represented in the user-provided imagecomparing the second image information to the plurality of item information associated with the plurality of items included in the plurality of catalogs associated with the first plurality of sellers;determining, based at least in part on the comparison of the second image information to the plurality of item information, that the second item corresponds to a third item from the plurality of items;determining, from the first plurality of sellers and based at least in part on the third item and the plurality of catalogs, a third plurality of sellers that sell the third item;associating the user-provided image with the third plurality of sellers in the mapping database;obtaining, from the user, a second selection of the second item represented in the user-provided image; andpresenting, in association with a representation of the second item or the third item, a second purchase control, wherein the second purchase control enables purchase of the third item from a second seller from the third plurality of sellers.

17. The computer-implemented method of claim 16, further comprising:obtaining, from the user, an interaction with the second purchase control; andinitiating a purchase of the third item from the second seller.

18. The computer-implemented method of claim 15, further comprising:generating a first feature vector of the item represented in the user-provided image;comparing the first feature vector to a plurality of feature vectors associated with the plurality of items included in the plurality of catalogs associated with the first plurality of sellers,wherein determining that the item corresponds to the first item from the plurality of items is based at least in part on at least one of the comparison of the first feature vector with the plurality of feature vectors or the comparison of the image information to the plurality of item information.

19. The computer-implemented method of claim 18, wherein comparing the first feature vector to the plurality of feature vectors associated with the plurality of items includes:generating a probability score for each of the plurality of items indicative of a similarity between the item represented in the user-provided image and each of the plurality of items; anddetermining that the probability score exceeds a threshold value.

20. The computer-implemented method of claim 18, further comprising:determining, based at least in part on at least one of the first feature vector or the image information, an item category associated with the item represented in the user-provided image; anddetermining the plurality of items based at least in part on the item category.
